title: (USA) Data Analyst III
description:
Position Summary...

What you'll do...

Delivering groceries to our customers in as little as an hour. Traveling with an ice cream in 100 degrees Phoenix weather. Re-routing deliveries during snowstorms and Super Bowl or delivering camping supplies for your weekend, Sounds simple right?? Our End to End(E2E) Delivery team utilizes hundreds of data points to create connections between stores, customers, shoppers, drivers, fulfillment centers and vendors.

As a Data Analyst Ill for E2E Delivery at Walmart, you will help pioneer ad hoc analytics, dashboards and insights for capacity, cost, fulfillment, and transportation to make Walmart's delivery platform one of the fastest and most reliable delivery services in the country. You will have access to our limitless global data and all the new data to be harvested from our customer and driver apps. You will be able to influence decisions that not only influence how we make decisions but also create an impact at an unprecedented scale.

What you will work on...

Our E2E Delivery team aims at enabling business partners through accessibility and of data and insights in real-time. This involves developing a fundamental understanding of transportation, driver and shopper behavior and creating reporting and ad hoc analyses for key business partners. The team creates fact-based models, root cause analyses and facilitates test & learn to make data-driven decisions.

Sample projects:
• Design and measurement of retail tests
• Building dashboards and metrics for new customer propositions such as Express delivery
• Root Cause analysis for primary reason for an order that was delivered late
• Understanding differences in performance of stores and markets

You'll make an impact by...
• Apply SQL and Visualization skills to create reports that show outputs of your analyses.
• Collaborating with business partners to gather the right information from various sources so that you can support analyses of key initiatives.
• Conduct exploratory analysis including hypothesis testing, and basic statistical testing.
• Automating tasks and developing processes that monitor, analyze, and inform the actions of key stakeholders.

You'll sweep us off our feet if...
• You have storytelling experience with data visualizations in Tableau, Looker, etc.
• You're an inquisitive and out-of-the-box thinker who is continually on the lookout for opportunities to improve and innovate analytic solutions
• You have a spirit of entrepreneurship and can connect the what with the why
• You are adaptable and have the courage to fail fast
• You have exposure to common statistical methods (e.g., Regression, Decision Trees, Random Forest, Clustering)
• Python or any scripting language is a plus

About Walmart E2E
Imagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. That’s what we do at Walmart E2E. We’re a team of software engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity expert's and service professionals within the world’s leading retailer who make an epic impact and are at the forefront of the next retail disruption. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. We are people-led and tech-empowered. We train our team in the skillsets of the future and bring in experts like you to help us grow. We have roles for those chasing their first opportunity as well as those looking for the opportunity that will define their career. Here, you can kickstart a great career in tech, gain new skills and experience for virtually every industry, or leverage your expertise to innovate at scale, impact millions and reimagine the future of retail.

Flexible, hybrid work:

We use a hybrid way of working that is primarily in office coupled with virtual when not onsite. Our campuses serve as a hub to enhance collaboration, bring us together for purpose and deliver on business needs. This approach helps us make quicker decisions, remove location barriers across our global team and be more flexible in our personal lives.

Benefits:
Benefits: Beyond our great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.

Equal Opportunity Employer:
Walmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer – By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions – while being inclusive of all people.

The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed in the role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The full Job Description can be made available as part of the hiring process.

At Walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based incentive awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. Health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. Financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company-paid life insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. Other benefits include short-term and long-term disability, company discounts, Military Leave Pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more.

You will also receive PTO and/or PPTO that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. The amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. It will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable. For information about PTO, see https://one.walmart.com/notices .

Live Better U is a Walmart-paid education benefit program for full-time and part-time associates in Walmart and Sam's Club facilities. Programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including English Language Learning and short-form certificates. Tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by Walmart.

Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms. For information about benefits and eligibility, see One.Walmart at https://bit.ly/3iOOb1J .

The annual salary range for this position is $84,000.00-$144,000.00

Additional compensation includes annual or quarterly performance incentives.

Additional compensation for certain positions may also include:

- Regional Pay Zone (RPZ) (based on location)

- Stock equity incentives

Minimum Qualifications...

Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.

Option 1: Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Arts, Finance or related field and 1 year's
experience in data analysis, data science, statistics, or related field. Option 2: 3 years' experience in data analysis, data science, statistics, or related field

Preferred Qualifications...

Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications.

Data science, data analysis, statistics, or related field, Master’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field, Related industry experience (for example, retail, merchandising, healthcare, eCommerce), Successful completion of assessments in data analysis and Business Intelligence tools and scripting languages (for example, SQL, Python, Spark, Scala, R, Power BI, or Tableau)

Primary Location...
702 SW 8TH ST, BENTONVILLE, AR 72716, United States of America

title: Energy Management Data Analyst
description:
Energy Management Data Analyst

O'Reilly Auto Parts continues to be one of the fastest-growing companies in our industry. As we grow opportunities for individual growth arise. O'Reilly is full of successful career stories and believes in a strong promote-from-within philosophy, encouraging you to grow your career along with the organization. We understand our growth comes from the hard work and... dedication of each O'Reilly team member.

That is why at O'Reilly we focus on:
• Our commitment towards fostering a culture and environment of belonging where everyone has access to and can achieve success
• Excellent customer service
• Providing our team members with a compensation package designed around offering the best price and quality available

Total Compensation Package:
• Competitive wage, PTO, paid Holidays, sick and vacation entitlements
• Stock purchase plan & 401k with employer contributions
• Medical, Dental, & Vision Insurance with optional Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
• Team Member Health/ Wellbeing Programs
• Educational Assistance
• Career Development Programs to support our Promote From Within philosophy
• Opportunities for advancement

To learn more about O'Reilly, our culture, and benefits visit https://orly.cc/Benefits

The Position:

The Energy Management Data Analyst will improve our organization's energy productivity by planning, monitoring and reducing energy use across all operations, while ensuring that all efforts are cost effective. This includes evaluating our stores systems on a daily basis, analyzing data to ensure efficient and proper operations.

What you will do in this position:
• Analyze, interpret, and communicate data from energy management system to reach conclusions and make recommendations.
• Responds to problems raised by building occupants, independently analyzes and pursues actions required to resolve such problems
• Assist in the development and implementation of short and long-range utility management goals and objectives
• Performing vendor research and selection
• Building automation control strategies Exception Reporting
• Analyze energy consumption histories on a daily basis to detect exceptions
• Diagnose, investigate and rectify detected problems
• Managing purchase orders, overseeing shipping schedules and maintaining purchase records with standardization

Qualifications we would like to see:
• Ability to multitask
• Willing to work on a team
• Experience with Microsoft Excel
• Strong analytical skills
• Excellent communication skills
• 2 years' experience in facilities maintenance or related experience desired

Benefits

All full time team members are eligible for a benefits package that is designed to offer convenience and security to our team members and their families. Programs, resources and benefit eligibility varies based on employment status, average hours worked, location and length of service
qualifications: ['Ability to multitask', 'Willing to work on a team', 'Experience with Microsoft Excel', 'Strong analytical skills', 'Excellent communication skills']

title: Health Plan Data Analyst III
description:
The Health Plan Data Analyst III is responsible for performing analysis of all data into, out of and within CareSource in support of the Health Partner Life Cycle team. SQL experience is required.

Essential Functions...
• Participate as a member of Health Partner Lifecycle (HPLC) team on all expansion and provider network development activities.
• Assimilate large quantities and/or complicated data into meaningful formats for tracking and status requirements.
• Monitors the quality of data submitted to regulatory agencies.
• Supports the verification of data accuracy through the use of CareSource data reconciliation tools
• Develops, documents and performs testing and validations as needed for process and system changes.
• Conducts root cause analysis on escalated provider data issues.
• Serve as Project Manager for select HPLC initiatives.
• Develop queries to aid in information retrieval, validation and updating of provider databases.
• Act as back-up for other team members as necessary.
• Perform any other job duties as requested

Education and Experience:
• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent years of relevant work experience is required.
• Minimum of three (3) years of data analysis or experience in a health care setting is required.
• Minimum of three(3) years of experience in data analysis and/or root cause analysis required
• Project management experience is preferred
• Experience working with data file reconciliation preferred
• Excellent customer service skills

Competencies, Knowledge and Skills:
• Proficient in data analysis
• Proven understanding of business process and critical thinking
• Advanced MS Excel, Access and Word skills
• Ability to work independently and within a team environment
• Analytical and graphical presentation skills
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Ability to meet tight deadlines
• Extreme flexibility as projects and priorities shift

Licensure and Certification:

​

Working Conditions:
• General office environment; may be required to sit or stand for extended periods of time

Compensation Range:
$66,700.00 - $106,700.00

Compensation Type:
Salary

title: Data Analyst
description:
Req ID: req16394

Position Number: AS7212...

Department: Institutional Resrch and Analytics

Location Address
Oklahoma State University
Stillwater, Oklahoma, 74078
United States

Hiring Supervisor: Larry Burns

Hiring Range
(Contingent upon available funding)
46,450.00 - 60,750.00, Salary

Work Schedule: Monday - Friday

Job Summary

Develop and maintain SQL or SAS programs to extract files and report on data from Operational Data Store systems and other auxiliary data systems.

Prepare, analyze, and summarize information into reports in response to requests from OSU administrators, faculty, students, or from agencies outside OSU.

Assist in developing and maintaining ePrint and other specialized reports available to colleges and other offices across campus.

Develop and apply statistical and mathematical models to optimize operational data usage.

Research and develop statistical models in response to OSU management objectives.

Participate in the development of management reports such as the Student Profile, Big 12 Data Exchange, Tuition and Fees, and the Common Data Set, as well as various institutional surveys (e.g. U.S. News Best Colleges Survey).

Develop and implement recommendations for maintaining efficient and streamlined data extraction programs.

Develop or assist in the development of analytics reports based on operational data for administrators and the public.

Assist in day to day management of institutional operational data stores and other data sources.

Working evenings and weekends is sometimes required to complete projects or meet deadlines.
Special Instructions to Applicants
Please submit your resume and list of references.

Position Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in business, math, computer science, MIS, statistics, education, or any technology-related degree.

Two years of experience related to analytics, statistical or mathematical modeling, or SQL programming.

Knowledge of general PC Systems such as Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Outlook, and data extraction/data analysis programs using SQL, SAS/SPSS, etc.

Individual must have excellent oral & written communication skills and the ability to maintain constructive relationships and work collaboratively with departmental co-workers, OSU administrators, faculty, staff, students, and off-campus entities.

Organizational Skills: Individual must be able to handle many tasks simultaneously, work under pressure, be self-motivated, conscientious, dedicated, able to meet deadlines, and appropriately prioritize projects within the framework of constant changes.

Preferred Qualifications:

Master's degree in business, math, computer science, MIS, statistics, education, or any technology-related degree.

Preferred experience with SQL, Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle SQL Developer, SAS Certified Base Programmer or SAS Certified Predictive Modeler Using SAS Enterprise Miner 14 or SAS Certified Platform Administrator

title: Data Analyst
description:
About Vanna Health

Vanna is reimagining healthcare for people living with serious mental illness (SMI...

Today, our healthcare system is failing people with SMI. Despite $200B in annual medical spending, people with SMI die 20 years younger than their peers while suffering from higher rates of preventable disease (2x). They also face a higher risk of disfranchisement from society, including homelessness (6x), unemployment (30x), and incarceration (25x).

Our mission is to empower people with SMI to thrive by finding purpose and a sense of belonging in the community. The solution is social, not just medical. Vanna provides psychosocial rehabilitation and enables community-based care at scale, in close collaboration with existing healthcare and community organizations. Our model is designed to restore hope and nurture engagement by investing in a foundation of mutual trust and respect.

Vanna brings together an unprecedented team of proven entrepreneurs, individuals with lived experience, and national leaders in behavioral health. We are committed to providing individuals with culturally inclusive support for all races, ethnicities, religions, sexual orientations, gender identities, and other social factors. With modern technology, extensive professional development opportunities, and a culture that actively promotes and fosters diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging, we are redefining what it means to work in community health.

About the Role

The Data Analyst role is critical for Vanna’s developing analytics capabilities. Your work will focus on providing data-driven insights from a wide range of data sources including payer claims, data collected from Vanna’s platform, health information exchange feeds, and EMR data. You’ll become a subject matter expert on all things data at Vanna, working hand-in-hand with our clinical, operations, product, and engineering teams to develop the technology and services that enable our Vanna Coaches to provide compassionate care to our members living with severe mental illness.

This is a unique opportunity to join a small but growing team, where you’ll have the opportunity to develop many of our foundational data capabilities from scratch. You have a growth mindset and are excited about expanding your technical skills and stepping into new responsibilities as the team and company grow.

Responsibilities

Work collaboratively across the entire Vanna team to design and implement Vanna’s clinical, operational, financial, and product KPIs, and create static reports as well as dynamic dashboards to bring them to life

Conduct ad-hoc analyses for internal stakeholders and clients, and present findings in a way that drives maximum impact

Rapidly evolve our common data model for members and claims to support emerging use cases

Help build out our business intelligence layer in support of self-service analytics

Partner with data engineers to evolve our internal data tooling

Partner with product engineers to ensure data collected by Vanna’s platform supports analytics use cases

Help shepherd data through our end-to-end data platform, resolving any data quality issues along the way

About You

4-6 years’ experience in analytics

Advanced SQL skills

Experience working with relational databases like Postgres, MySQL, or SQL Server

Experience working with analytical data stores, including columnar databases like Snowflake, Redshift, or BigQuery or data lakes like Delta Lake or Athena

Familiarity with dashboarding tools such as Looker, QuickSight, or Tableau

Intermediate to advanced Google Sheets or Excel skills

Basic knowledge of Python or a desire to learn

Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate on a growing team

A detective mindset – you love getting to the root of problems and using data to solve them

Experience working with healthcare data strongly preferred

Our Promise to You

You will have a critical seat at the table - one that represents our staff and the members we serve

You will be valued, respected, and heard - diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging is paramount

You will be joining a team and community that is passionate about improving the lives of underserved individuals

Benefits

We currently offer unlimited PTO (and people actually take it!),

Full medical, dental, and vision benefits.

401k

Flexibility to work remotely

Competitive compensation including salary and significant ownership in Vanna Health

Vanna Health focuses on Healthcare and Mental Health. Their company has offices in San Francisco. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees. To date, Vanna Health has raised $29M of funding; their latest round was closed on January 2023.

You can view their website at https://www.vanna.health/ or find them on LinkedIn

title: Data Analyst (Contract)
description:
Business Intelligence Engineer

12 Month Contract...

$40/hour to $50/hour

Overview:

In this role, you will play a pivotal role in automating processes, ensuring data quality, and enhancing efficiency. If you possess a diverse skill set spanning data analytics and quality engineering, this opportunity is for you.

Responsibilities:

ETL Automation (Approximately 60%)
• Extract raw data from source systems.
• Transform and cleanse data for analysis.
• Load processed data into databases/systems.
• Automate data pipelines using Python.
• Reduce the need for manual data tasks.
• Ensure the timely and accurate flow of data.

Front-End Dash boarding (Approximately 20%)
• Enhance interactive PowerBI dashboards used by leadership teams.
• Ensure dashboards are accurate, intuitive, and meet end users' needs.
• Effectively utilize data visualizations to identify insights.

Documentation and Miscellaneous (Approximately 20%)
• Manage communications with stakeholders.
• Update documentation related to data sources, ETL processes, and dashboards.

Skills:
• Proficiency in SQL for querying databases for data analysis.
• Strong coding skills in Python or R for writing ETL scripts and automation.
• Experience with data pipelining and ETL automation.
• Familiarity with PowerBI for building interactive dashboards and visualizations (less important for this role).

Desirable Skills:
• Exceptional attention to detail.
• Experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies.
• Ability to perform test automation, including writing scripts to validate analysts and dashboards.

Background:
• 4 to 5 years of relevant experience is preferred, but we can be flexible on industry and background.
• Previous experience in OEM/Automotive is a plus, but we welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Position Summary: The Data Analyst Senior shall analyze metrics, identify areas ofconcern, provide trend analysis, and be proactive in identifying future problems. Must demonstrate knowledge and skills in Structured Query Language (SQL) query development and scripting; possess knowledge and skills in creating, developing, and designing performance measures utilizing Tableau Creator software... proficient in the development and scripting of MS SharePoint lists and views.

Duties and Responsibilities:
• Produce and format a multitude of metrics that shall impact the organization’s outcomes, goals, objectives, and strategic plan.
• Provide graphical data to demonstrate trends and other statistical data to user-level as well as senior executives.
• Evaluate and recommend performance measures for METC.
• Make recommendations that shall provide ongoing improvements to the organization.
• Implement approved recommendations with the creation of live, real-time dashboards.
• Analyze metrics, identify areas of concern, provide trend analysis, and be proactive in identifying future problems.
• Establish, design, and maintain performance metrics for all areas of METC.
• Assist leadership in identifying important areas for metrics.
• Collect and input data to produce the most accurate metrics possible.
• Work with Information Management/Information Technology on processes to streamline data collection.

Education and Experience:
• Bachelor’s + 14 years of work experience
• Master’s + 10 years of work experience.
• Minimum of ten (10) years of experience.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

• Must demonstrate knowledge and skills in Structured Query Language (SQL) query development and scripting.
• Must possess knowledge and skills in creating, developing, and designing performance measures utilizing Tableau Creator software.
• Excellent communication skills, ability to work with multiple functional areas and levels of expertise, and ability to identify and mitigate risk.
• Knowledge of computer equipment and the assigned area of system software.
• Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite and able to incorporate programs including Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Word, and able to develop and script MS SharePoint lists and views.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Company Details

Intrepid Direct Insurance (IDI) is a rapidly growing innovative property and casualty company and a member of the W. R. Berkley Corporation, a fortune 500 company, rated A+ (Superior) by A.M. Best. Our vision is to create the most efficient insurance experience for our customers leveraging technology and our deep knowledge of our customer’s needs. Our team is comprised of “A”... level talent and innovative thinkers. You will be part of a highly collaborative team of talented and focused professionals. Join a group that enjoys working together, trusts each other, and takes pride in our hard-earned success.

Responsibilities

The Data Analyst will be responsible for developing and delivering accurate and timely information to stakeholders across the organization. This role will have the opportunity to work across levels and disciplines to identify and execute opportunities for data-driven improvements by rapidly evolving our data and reporting infrastructure.
• Independently or in collaboration with others, gather requirements for reports and data extracts.
• Comfortable working with a variety of data sources and structures.
• Map and conform data between multiple data sources as required to respond to data requests.
• Responsible for meeting deadlines for outstanding data requests, including recurring data needs for internal and external audiences.
• Descriptive Analysis
• Applies business logic to raw data to create business information for reporting and decision making.
• Execute ad-hoc reporting on behalf of the business community
• Respond to urgent data/reporting needs effectively.
• Assist in defining measurements, metrics and KPIs to use data to drive the business forward.
• Create and maintain SQL queries for reporting.
• Create and maintain SSRS reports
• Visualize data and KPIs using Power BI
• Diagnostic Analysis o Creates ad-hoc SQL for analysis and investigation.
• Identify, document and collaborate with other teams to resolve issues pertaining to data quality in source systems.
• Interacts and effectively collaborates with all levels of employees across various departments.
• Must exhibit professional behavior at all times while representing the company.

Qualifications
• Minimum 2 years’ experience in information management / reporting related function.
• Property casualty insurance experience highly desirable.
• Familiarity with Data Vault methodology highly desirable.
• Proven track record of delivery.
• Comfortable working in agile environment and familiar with source control tools.
• Must be able to communicate effectively across disciplines.
• Excellent knowledge of SQL; Transact-SQL, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS); Excel; Power BI.
• Self-starter, resilient with a strong desire to learn.

Additional Company Details
We do not accept unsolicited resumes from third party recruiting agencies or firms. The company offers a competitive compensation plan and robust benefits package for full time regular employees. The Company is an equal employment opportunity employer. https://intrepiddirect.com/
Additional Requirements
In office workplace Travel approximately 15% While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be seated for sustained periods of time; be able to pick up, pinch, twist, or keyboard; must be able to communicate detailed or important information accurately; distinguish sounds at normal levels (with or without correction) and be able to receive detailed information orally. The employee is occasionally required to move about the office to accomplish tasks; ability to reach in any direction; raise or lower objects or move objects from place to place; and hold onto objects. Occasionally, the employee may need to move or exert force up to 10 pounds. The employee is regularly required to operate a computer and other office equipment (phone, copier and printer).
Sponsorship Details
Sponsorship not Offered for this Role

title: Senior Data Analyst, Strategy & Operations
description:
About Attentive:

Attentive® is the leader in conversational commerce, reinventing business to consumer communication. Our SMS-first software platform helps everyone from entrepreneurs to enterprises strengthen relationships with their consumers in a new way. Through two-way, real-time, personalized communications, we drive billions in e-commerce revenue and over 8,000 leading brands like CB2... Urban Outfitters, Crocs, Jack in the Box, and Coach rely on Attentive to deliver powerful commerce experiences.

Attentive’s growth has been recognized by Deloitte’s Fast 500, Linkedin’s Top Startups and Forbes Cloud 100 all thanks to the hard work from our global employees!

Who we are

The Strategy & Ops Analytics team is a lean team responsible for uncovering trends and insights to propel the business across all analytical functional areas: product analytics, marketing analytics, sales and go-to-market initiatives. We are looking for a Data Analyst to be the resident expert on Attentive products. This is a unique opportunity to build Attentive’s product analytics foundation in partnership with the Product and Strategy teams. This includes reporting & delivering insights on revenue initiatives critical to achieving Attentive’s goals.

This role is crucial to Attentive & our clients’ success and has high leadership visibility. Ideal candidates love breaking down problems, building solutions, delivering actionable and data-driven insights, and working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Why Attentive needs you
• Partner with cross-functional teams to identify and quantify the impact of new opportunities to improve the client experience on Attentive
• Identify key metrics and build exec-facing dashboards to track progress of the business and its highest priority initiatives
• Uncover insights to drive key revenue initiatives
• Develop analytics frameworks to run AB tests and measure the success of product features and initiatives

Who you are
• 3+ years of relevant work experience in analytics, data science, or business intelligence with experiencing using a data visualization tool (Looker, Tableau, Qlikview, MicroStrategy)
• Experience using, writing and optimizing SQL queries in a business environment
• Knowledge of statistics and experience running A/B tests
• Knowledge of data warehouse technical architecture, infrastructure components, ETL and reporting/analytic tools and environments
• Ability to execute fast-paced and dynamic projects in a highly organized manner
• You have an inherent curiosity and analytic follow-through; you can’t help but ask “why?” and love using data and logic to explore potential solutions
• Experience effectively communicating the results of analyses with stakeholders to drive strategy decisions
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, or equivalent work experience

You'll get competitive perks and benefits from health care to home office equipment, to help you bring your best self to work!

For US based applicants:

The standard base salary range for this position is $113,200 to $150,000.

This position is eligible for equity in the form of RSUs

#LI-NR1

Attentive Company Values

Default to Action - Move swiftly and with purpose

Be One Unstoppable Team - Rally as each other’s champions

Champion the Customer - Our success is defined by our customers' success

Act Like an Owner - Take responsibility for Attentive’s success

Learn more about AWAKE, Attentive’s collective of employee resource groups.

If you do not meet all the requirements listed here, we still encourage you to apply! No job description is perfect, and we may also have another opportunity that closely matches your skills and experience.

At Attentive, we know that our Company's strength lies in the diversity of our employees. Attentive is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. Our policy is to provide equal employment opportunities for all employees, applicants and covered individuals regardless of protected characteristics. We prioritize and maintain a fair, inclusive and equitable workplace free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation

title: Senior Associate, Data Analysis
description: Who We Are Kyndryl is a market leader that thinks and acts like a start-up. We design, build, manage, and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward – always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers, and our communities... The Role Join Kyndryl as a Data Analyst where you will unlock the power of data to drive strategic decisions and shape the future of our business. As a key member of our team, you will harness your expertise in basic statistics, business fundamentals, and communication to uncover valuable insights and transform raw data into rigorous visualizations and compelling stories. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work closely with our customers as part of a top-notch team. You will dive deep into vast IT datasets, unraveling the mysteries hidden within, and discovering trends and patterns that will revolutionize our customers' understanding of their own landscapes. Armed with your advanced analytical skills, you will draw compelling conclusions and develop data-driven insights that will directly impact their decision-making processes. Your role goes beyond traditional data analysis. You will be a trusted advisor, utilizing your domain expertise, critical thinking, and consulting skills to unravel complex business problems and translate them into innovative solutions. Your proficiency in cutting-edge software tools and technologies will empower you to gather, explore, and prepare data – ensuring it is primed for analysis, business intelligence, and insightful visualizations. Collaboration will be at the heart of your work. As a Data Analyst at Kyndryl, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, pooling together your collective expertise to gather, structure, organize, and clean data. Together, we will ensure the data is in its finest form, ready to deliver actionable insights. Your unique ability to communicate and empathize with stakeholders will be invaluable. By understanding the business objectives and success criteria of each project, you will align your data analysis efforts seamlessly with our overarching goals. With your mastery of business valuation, decision-making, project scoping, and storytelling, you will transform data into meaningful narratives that drive real-world impact. At Kyndryl, we believe that data holds immense potential, and we are committed to helping you unlock that potential. You will have access to vast repositories of data, empowering you to delve deep to determine root causes of defects and variation. By gaining a comprehensive understanding of the data and its specific purpose, you will be at the forefront of driving innovation and making a difference. If you are ready to unleash your analytical ability, collaborate with industry experts, and shape the future of data-driven decision making, then join us as a Data Analyst at Kyndryl. Together, we will harness the power of data to redefine what is possible and create a future filled with limitless possibilities. Your Future at Kyndryl Every position at Kyndryl offers a way forward to grow your career. We have opportunities that you won’t find anywhere else, including hands-on experience, learning opportunities, and the chance to certify in all four major platforms. Whether you want to broaden your knowledge base or narrow your scope and specialize in a specific sector, you can find your opportunity here. If you are hired, the anticipated compensation range for the position $56,970 to $129,880 is based on a full-time schedule. Your ultimate compensation may vary depending on your geography, job-related skills, and experience. For part time roles, the compensation will be adjusted appropriately. Kyndryl currently does not require employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, however, if you are hired to work at a client, customer, or partner location, you may be required to show proof of vaccination to align with their respective COVID-19 vaccination policies. Those who believe they are eligible may apply for a medical or religious accommodation prior to the start of employment. Who You Are You’re good at what you do and possess the required experience to prove it. However, equally as important – you have a growth mindset; keen to drive your own personal and professional development. You are customer-focused – someone who prioritizes customer success in their work. And finally, you’re open and borderless – naturally inclusive in how you work with others. Required Skills and Experience •Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and critical-thinking skills •Communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data insights to both technical and non-technical audiences •Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, while maintaining a high level of attention to detail Preferred Skills and Experience •Degree in a quantitative discipline, such as industrial engineering, finance, or economics •Knowledge of data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g. Looker, Power BI, QuickSight, BigQuery, Azure Synapse, Python, R, or SQL) •Professional certification, e.g., ASQ Six Sigma •Cloud platform certification, e.g., AWS Certified Data Analytics – Specialty, Google Cloud Looker Business Analyst, or Microsoft Certified: Power BI Data Analyst Associate Being You Diversity is a whole lot more than what we look like or where we come from, it’s how we think and who we are. We welcome people of all cultures, backgrounds, and experiences. But we’re not doing it single-handily: Our Kyndryl Inclusion Networks are only one of many ways we create a workplace where all Kyndryls can find and provide support and advice. This dedication to welcoming everyone into our company means that Kyndryl gives you – and everyone next to you – the ability to bring your whole self to work, individually and collectively, and support the activation of our equitable culture. That’s the Kyndryl Way. What You Can Expect With state-of-the-art resources and Fortune 100 clients, every day is an opportunity to innovate, build new capabilities, new relationships, new processes, and new value. Our employee learning hub gives you access to the best learning in the industry to receive certifications and accreditations, including Microsoft University, AWS Cloud Center of Excellence, Udemy, and the Harvard Business Review. Through our company-wide volunteering and giving platform, you can donate, start fundraisers, volunteer, and search over 2 million non-profit organizations. At Kyndryl, we invest heavily in you! We want you to succeed so that together, we will all succeed. Welcome! We’re glad you’re here. Take a look around at the many exciting career opportunities we have available and apply today! Can’t find a suitable job opening? Drop off your CV/Resume Drop off your CV/Resume and a Recruiter will reach out with related career information that match your experience and expertise. Sign up for Job Alerts Create your account and then sign up for job alerts. When new jobs become available that meet your criteria, you’ll be alerted right away! At Kyndryl, curiosity is at the core of innovation. It fuels the most vital need inside us—the need to progress. To be a Kyndryl means standing up for Progress and going all in, fully committing to our customers and their progress. As we grow, our curiosity opens new worlds, new ways of thinking and solving problems. It helps us in our career and to find joy in our work. What sparks your curiosity

title: Data Analyst
description:
About Vanna Health

Vanna is reimagining healthcare for people living with serious mental illness (SMI...

Today, our healthcare system is failing people with SMI. Despite $200B in annual medical spending, people with SMI die 20 years younger than their peers while suffering from higher rates of preventable disease (2x). They also face a higher risk of disfranchisement from society, including homelessness (6x), unemployment (30x), and incarceration (25x).

Our mission is to empower people with SMI to thrive by finding purpose and a sense of belonging in the community. The solution is social, not just medical. Vanna provides psychosocial rehabilitation and enables community-based care at scale, in close collaboration with existing healthcare and community organizations. Our model is designed to restore hope and nurture engagement by investing in a foundation of mutual trust and respect.

Vanna brings together an unprecedented team of proven entrepreneurs, individuals with lived experience, and national leaders in behavioral health. We are committed to providing individuals with culturally inclusive support for all races, ethnicities, religions, sexual orientations, gender identities, and other social factors. With modern technology, extensive professional development opportunities, and a culture that actively promotes and fosters diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging, we are redefining what it means to work in community health.

About the Role

The Data Analyst role is critical for Vanna’s developing analytics capabilities. Your work will focus on providing data-driven insights from a wide range of data sources including payer claims, data collected from Vanna’s platform, health information exchange feeds, and EMR data. You’ll become a subject matter expert on all things data at Vanna, working hand-in-hand with our clinical, operations, product, and engineering teams to develop the technology and services that enable our Vanna Coaches to provide compassionate care to our members living with severe mental illness.

This is a unique opportunity to join a small but growing team, where you’ll have the opportunity to develop many of our foundational data capabilities from scratch. You have a growth mindset and are excited about expanding your technical skills and stepping into new responsibilities as the team and company grow.

Responsibilities

Work collaboratively across the entire Vanna team to design and implement Vanna’s clinical, operational, financial, and product KPIs, and create static reports as well as dynamic dashboards to bring them to life

Conduct ad-hoc analyses for internal stakeholders and clients, and present findings in a way that drives maximum impact

Rapidly evolve our common data model for members and claims to support emerging use cases

Help build out our business intelligence layer in support of self-service analytics

Partner with data engineers to evolve our internal data tooling

Partner with product engineers to ensure data collected by Vanna’s platform supports analytics use cases

Help shepherd data through our end-to-end data platform, resolving any data quality issues along the way

About You

4-6 years’ experience in analytics

Advanced SQL skills

Experience working with relational databases like Postgres, MySQL, or SQL Server

Experience working with analytical data stores, including columnar databases like Snowflake, Redshift, or BigQuery or data lakes like Delta Lake or Athena

Familiarity with dashboarding tools such as Looker, QuickSight, or Tableau

Intermediate to advanced Google Sheets or Excel skills

Basic knowledge of Python or a desire to learn

Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate on a growing team

A detective mindset – you love getting to the root of problems and using data to solve them

Experience working with healthcare data strongly preferred

Our Promise to You

You will have a critical seat at the table - one that represents our staff and the members we serve

You will be valued, respected, and heard - diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging is paramount

You will be joining a team and community that is passionate about improving the lives of underserved individuals

Benefits

We currently offer unlimited PTO (and people actually take it!),

Full medical, dental, and vision benefits.

401k

Flexibility to work remotely

Competitive compensation including salary and significant ownership in Vanna Health

Vanna Health focuses on Healthcare and Mental Health. Their company has offices in San Francisco. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees. To date, Vanna Health has raised $29M of funding; their latest round was closed on January 2023.

You can view their website at https://www.vanna.health/ or find them on LinkedIn

title: Lead Data Analyst, Graduate Student Affairs, Wharton School
description:
Job Description Summary

The Lead Data Analyst role will be an integral part of the Data Science team within Graduate Student Affairs at the Wharton school. Reporting to the Director of Data Science for Graduate Student Affairs, this position will work cross divisionally across admissions, career management, student life and financial aid for the full-time, Executive and Global MBA programs. This... role will support the School’s mission in providing a personalized and student-centric student experience, and will harness the power of data and technology to help inform strategic initiatives aimed at guiding students to optimal outcomes.
Job Description

This position requires advanced skills in data visualization and an ability to communicate data insights to both technical and non-technical audiences in order to help inform strategy. The ability to build dashboards in PowerBI is strongly preferred. Additionally, this role will be responsible for supporting data collection efforts, ensuring quality and integrity of data, and cleaning and processing data for analysis. Intermediate to advanced statistical programming skills in R and/or Python are required, as is a willingness to constantly learn and improve one’s technical skill set. An understanding of the infrastructure of data warehouses is strongly preferred, as is the ability to query a data warehouse, preferably using SQL; otherwise, a willingness to learn these skills quickly is required. Experience with survey design and analysis, as well as experience with Qualtrics, are strongly preferred. Qualitative data analysis skills is a plus, as is experience with people analytics.

A key component of this role is to communicate technical and quantitative concepts to a broad, non-technical audience, including senior management, and to train and provide technical support and thought partnership to colleagues. Advanced skills in PowerPoint are strongly preferred.

Additionally, strong collaboration and consultation skills are very important for this role. The Data Analyst will partner with various teams throughout the division to support their data collection and analysis efforts and to provide them with insights that will help inform their strategy and ultimately their ability to better serve students. The Data Analyst will be expected to be able to work both independently and as part of a team, and to contribute to multiple projects at a time.

Qualifications:

A Bachelor’s Degree (quantitative discipline preferred) and 3+ years of experience or equivalent combination of education and experience is required.
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of statistics/statistical analysis and R/Python, Excel is required (proficient in use of formulas, pivot tables, graphs/charts; macros, etc. preferred).
Expert data visualization skills and the ability to tell a story with data are required
Proficiency with data visualization software, such as PowerBI and/or Tableau, required. Experience building dashboards and reports in these environments is strongly preferred.
Understanding of data warehouse architecture and the ability to write SQL queries to extract data is strongly preferred; willingness and ability to quickly learn these skills is required
Proven ability to use data to inform strategy, including being able to communicate highly technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences
Attention to detail is crucial to this position; in particular, ability and willingness to process and scrub large amounts of data from various sources, as well as having a keen eye for data integrity and quality issues
Clear understanding of FERPA parameters and data integrity.
Cross-train within Systems, Data Science and Marketing and Communications teams to carry out responsibilities on an as-needed basis.
Ability to perform tasks in a fast-paced environment, with tight deadlines
Strong communication skills, both written and oral, are required

title: Data Analyst
description:
Who we are

About Stripe...

Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.

About the team

Data Science at Stripe is a vibrant community where data analysts, data scientists and engineers learn and grow together. As a part of the MoneyPlatform DS team, you will collaborate with partners who build Stripe’s foundational revenue platform and seller systems. You will work with some of Stripe’s most fundamental and exciting data, and use that data to help drive company-wide initiatives.

What you’ll do

In this role, you will work closely with partners to extract insights from Stripe’s rich and complex pricing and revenue data. You will also work with leaders to translate business needs into data problems. Examples include creating scalable data pipelines and reports showcasing pricing insights, price history, distribution and trends at individual and segment levels. You will also use data to identify opportunities and measure progress in operational and engineering efforts to improve Stripe’s revenue generation process. Additionally, you will build metrics and dashboards to monitor the performance of our revenue foundation and billing system.

Responsibilities
• Work closely with business and engineering partners to translate business requirements to data problems.
• Be the domain expert in billing, pricing and revenue data and can effectively convert data into insights.
• Design, build and maintain data pipelines, metrics and dashboards to improve the availability and visibility of data and insights.
• Partner with leaders to effectively provide data and data insights and clearly communicate the context around the data.
• Partner with product managers, engineering and business partners to initiate and execute analytical projects, including scoping, identifying data source, constructing meaningful metrics and building pipelines and reports.

Who you are

We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.

Minimum requirements
• 3+ years experience in Business Intelligence Engineering, Data Engineering, Data Analysis or Data Science roles, building data pipelines and analyzing large datasets to solve problems
• Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field like Statistics, Economics, Science or Engineering
• Proficiency in SQL and Python
• Strong statistical knowledge
• Expertise in visualization and using data insights to make recommendations and achieve goals
• Proven ability to manage and deliver on multiple projects with great attention to detail
• Ability to clearly communicate results and drive impact
• Comfortable collaborating across functions to identify data analytics problems and execute solutions with technical rigor and data-driven insights.

Preferred qualifications
• * Master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, or a related technical field.
• Prior experience at a growth stage internet or software company.
• Experience with distributed data frameworks like Hadoop and Spark to write and debug data pipelines.
• Good understanding of development processes and best practices like engineering standards, code reviews, and testing.
• Prior experience working with engineering teams

title: Student Employee - Data Analyst (Fall)
description:
The Student Data Analyst will play a crucial role in assisting the Data Analysis team within the Dodge Family College of Arts and Sciences Dean's Office. This position is ideal for humanities and social science majors who want to learn about leveraging data to construct precise and compelling narratives and support research initiatives. The Student Data Analyst will work on various data-related... tasks, including building simple dashboards in Excel, retrieving data from external sources for comparative analyses, and creating data-driven PowerPoint presentations.

Responsibilities:
• Collaborate with the data analysis team to build and maintain data dashboards in Excel.
• Retrieve and compile data from external sources for comparative analyses and research purposes.
• Assist in creating data-driven PowerPoint presentations for internal stakeholders.
• Work on data-related research projects and support in communicating insights effectively.
• Occasionally handle confidential information and ensure compliance with relevant regulations.
• Participate in training programs related to data privacy and confidentiality.

Required Document:
• Resume
• Cover Letter
• Class Schedule
• Academic Transcripts

Required Education: Must be currently enrolled as a student at the University of Oklahoma. Hiring contingent upon verification of current student status.
• Must attach Fall 2023 class schedule.

Skills:
• Ability to maintain academic progress while managing a flexible work schedule.
• Highly organized, dependable, and detail oriented.
• Effective communication skills, both written and verbal.
• Deadline-oriented with strong time management skills.
• Ability to collaborate effectively within a team, demonstrating a positive attitude and a willingness to contribute to a collegial work environment.
• Strong ability to organize and prioritize tasks.
• Familiar with Microsoft Office suite, particularly Excel and PowerPoint.

Advertised Physical Requirements:
• Standard office environment. Must be able to travel to various campus offices. Must be able to lift up to 20 pounds.

Department Preferences:
• Dodge Family College of Arts and Sciences humanities or social science majors are strongly encouraged to apply.
• Previous experience or coursework in data analysis, statistics, research, or related fields is a plus, but not a requirement.
• Interest in data visualization tools and techniques is an advantage.

Special Instructions: If you are selected as a final candidate for this position, you will be subject to The University of Oklahoma Norman Campus Tuberculosis Testing policy. To view the policy, visit https://hr.ou.edu/Policies-Handbooks/TB-Testing.

Diversity Statement: The University of Oklahoma is committed to achieving a diverse, equitable, and inclusive university community by recognizing each person's unique contributions, background, and perspectives. The University of Oklahoma strives to cultivate a sense of belonging and emotional support for all, recognizing that fostering an inclusive environment for all is vital in the pursuit of academic and inclusive excellence in all aspects of our institutional mission.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: The University of Oklahoma, in compliance with all applicable federal and state laws and regulations, does not discriminate based on race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, genetic information, gender identity, gender expression, age, religion, disability, political beliefs, or status as a veteran in any of its policies, practices, or procedures. This includes, but is not limited to, admissions, employment, financial aid, housing, services in educational programs or activities, and health care services that the University operates or provides

description:

Location: MN-New Brighton, Hybrid 1-2 days on site...

Overview: Crew helps our clients deliver change through IT project delivery, business process improvement, and operational efficiency efforts. Our high-performing consultants are natural leaders who manage a wide range of responsibilities that vary from assignment to assignment. Our consultant training programs, investment in career development, and premier client portfolio ensure constant challenge and rapid growth for our employees. Other duties as needed or assigned

Data driven and analytically focused approach

Exceptional time management and organizational skills

Strong character, ethics, commitment, and reliability

Proficient in Microsoft Office and Microsoft PowerPoint

Experience with SAP and/or Concur highly desired

title: Senior Workday Financial Data Analyst (Adaptive Insights) (Remote)
description:
Progressive Leasing is a leading provider of in-store and e-commerce lease-to-own solutions. As an almost 20+ year old FinTech company that has gone from start-up to industry leader, we know how to innovate, simplify, and value all people. We are a company founded on our grit and we are constantly looking to the future. As an ever-evolving group of entrepreneurs and technologists, we strive to do... the right thing period in all aspects of our work. We are a subsidiary of PROG Holdings (NYSE: PRG), an exciting FinTech holding company, with three business segments including Progressive, Vive Financial, and Four, a Buy Now Pay Later (BNPL) platform. 

 

We are currently hiring a Senior Financial Data Analyst to help grow our company and ensure our mission is achieved!

This role is a work from home position and can be performed remotely anywhere in the continental US or in one of our corporate locations in Utah or Arizona.

 

Employee Value Proposition (EVP): PROG is dedicated to providing people with opportunity; opportunity for inclusive collaboration, opportunity for innovation, and opportunity for development.

 

WE ARE: A team of financial experts focused on the adherence of reporting and planning our Progressive Leasing’s financial wellness. Progressive Leasing is known for the high-quality assistance that we provide, and we love to continuously pursue excellence and compassion in all that we do! We are dedicated to creating a culture of belonging, inclusion, diversity, and equity in our teams and celebrate each individual contributions and uniqueness. 

 

YOU ARE:  As a Senior Financial Data Analyst on the FP&A team, you will play a crucial role in extracting, analyzing, and visualizing financial data to support various business functions. Your expertise in advanced SQL, data visualization tools such as Tableau, and experience with planning tools such as Adaptive Insights will be instrumental in helping our organization make data-driven decisions and achieve its financial goals.

OUR DAY-TO-DAY:
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify data requirements and design solutions for complex financial analyses.
• Utilize advanced SQL techniques to extract, clean, and manipulate large datasets from various sources, including our financial systems and databases.
• Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Tableau, presenting data in a clear and visually appealing manner.
• Collaborate with finance and accounting teams to gather business requirements and design financial models within Adaptive Insights to support budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning.
• Develop and enhance financial reports, dashboards, and KPIs in Tableau and Adaptive Insights to deliver actionable insights to key stakeholders.
• Work closely with business leaders to understand their reporting needs and provide ad-hoc analyses as required.
• Stay up to date with industry trends and advancements in technology to recommend and implement new features and functionalities.

YOU’LL BRING:
• Bachelor's or Master's degree in Finance, Economics, Statistics, or a related field.
• 3-5+ years of proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in Finance.
• Modeling experience with Adaptive Insights or similar FP&A tools
• Strong proficiency in advanced SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
• Expertise in data visualization and dashboarding tools, particularly Tableau.
• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail.
• Strong communication and presentation abilities to convey complex findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
• Ability to work independently, manage multiple projects, and meet tight deadlines.

WE OFFER:
• Competitive Compensation
• Full Health Benefits; Medical/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance + Paid Parental Leave
• Company Matched 401k
• Paid Time Off + Paid Holidays + Paid Volunteer Time
• Diversity Alliance Resource Groups
• Employee Stock Purchase Program
• Tuition Reimbursement
• Charitable Gift Matching
• Job Required Equipment & Services Will Be Provided

Progressive Leasing welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate in any aspect of employment on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, age, veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local employment discrimination laws where Progressive Leasing does business

title: Risk Data Analyst
description:
The Risk Data Analyst is responsible for gathering, optimizing, interpreting and presenting operational data to the Risk Analytics Manager for reporting to senior and executive management, investors and regulators. Leveraging their depth of mortgage-specific knowledge and statistical analysis, the Risk Data Analyst will prepare and deliver data and analytics that will enhance the quality of loans... originated and purchased by CMG and ensure compliance with regulators.

The Risk Data Analyst is extremely proficient in understanding mortgage loan data and standard industry processes for a full-scale mortgage banking company. A firm understanding of short and long-term risk related to industry compliance is necessary, including how those risks evolve throughout the life of the loan – from origination through servicing.

Key Focus:
• Standard and ad hoc regulatory reporting

Primary Responsibilities:
• Obtain, prepare, decipher, scrub and deliver data with summary analysis to senior-level management
• Coordinate with stakeholders in Compliance, Servicing, Accounting, Licensing, External Audit and Marketing departments to obtain and analyze current practices, policies and procedures as they relate to fair lending and regulatory reporting
• Apply current federal laws and regulatory requirements governing mortgage to analysis (i.e., Fair Housing, TILA, RESPA, TRID, ECOA, etc.)
• Prepare RMLA data for submission for multiple lines of business ad hoc, monthly and quarterly
• Complete ad hoc Fair Lending Analysis (marketing, pricing, underwriting, fallout, redlining, matched-pairs, regression, etc.)
• Communicate sound recommendations for improvement to operational and marketing processes
• Uphold business continuity principles by documenting processes and tracking projects proactively and consistently in coordination with the team

Other requirements:
• Minimum 7 years’ experience in the mortgage industry (origination, servicing, insurance) with at least 2 of those years in a compliance-related capacity (some underwriting or quality control experience preferred)
• Mortgage-specific loan origination system experience (prefer experience with Byte Pro)
• Minimum 5 years’ experience utilizing Microsoft Excel in a professional setting (solid intermediate-level experience required*)
• Bachelor’s degree preferred but not required (passion for and solid understanding of statistical analysis and communicating clearly and professionally are requirements*)
• SharePoint, Microsoft Teams, XML and SQL experience is preferred
• Experience working with NContracts and/or TruPoint Fair Lending software is preferred
• Familiarity with various social media platforms and modern marketing practices is preferred
• Must be comfortable task-switching and re-prioritizing workload to meet deadlines
• Ability to work remotely in a paperless environment while adhering to strict privacy rules and regulations (necessary equipment will be provided)
• Extraordinary attention to detail

The ideal candidate for this position is one who not only meets the requirements of this position, but who is also passionate about identifying disparities using proven mathematical analysis. You want to find weaknesses in operational processes and brainstorm ways to strengthen those processes, and when your original ideas don’t fit, you’re motivated to come up with new ones. You want time to play with data independently, but you also enjoy working with others toward a common goal in a sometimes-high stress environment.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: Direct Reports: N/A

PHYSICAL and ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS

Standard office environment, equipment and tasks, including work at a computer terminal.
This position requires partial sitting and walking throughout the day. Employee must be open to work overtime to complete assigned tasks.

Base Compensation Information – This is a remote role that can be performed from within the United States. Residents of the states of CA & CO, and for New York City are excluded from this remote role at this time. Information regarding base wages provided upon request.

#LI-DNI

title: Insurance Data Analyst III / Insurance Data Analyst - Supervisor
description: Company: NICO National Indemnity Company As a member of the Berkshire Hathaway group of insurance companies, we offer outstanding opportunities for professionals interested in working with a successful company. We offer unparalleled financial strength, stability and “large company” benefits, in addition to an exciting, friendly, “small company” atmosphere. Want to work for a company with unparalleled financial strength and stability that also offers “large company” benefits with an exciting, friendly, and “small company” atmosphere? As a member of the Berkshire Hathaway Group of Insurance Companies you will find that as well as outstanding opportunities for professionals looking to grow in their careers. The Insurance Data Analyst or Insurance Data Analyst Supervisor will serve as a “Lead” to coordinate certain activities of several insurance and reinsurance operations and/or contracted insurance programs within the responsibilities of the Insurance Data Management Unit. The... activities include but are not limited to insurance data collection, data transfers, data manipulation and/or analysis, accounting, cash activity, financial and statistical reporting) of one or more current categories of Unit responsibility. Proposes, develops and implements strategies, in collaboration with other Unit Leads and under direction and review of the Manager/Administrator, to coordinate activities and accomplish goals effectively and efficiently. Reviews or completes special reports required by States or agencies and compiles data for Finance personnel, Berkshire Hathaway Corporate personnel, actuaries, auditors, examiners and Company managers. . This position will be with National Indemnity Company in Omaha, NE, and has the ability to be hybrid after a period of training and at management discretion. This position is not eligible for employer visa sponsorship. What will you do? Coordinates Unit activities such as data collection, capture, storage, retrieval and/or manipulation for assigned categories of Unit responsibilities. Analyzes system requirements, coding, reports and information sharing related to assigned categories of Unit responsibility. Receives, evaluates and/or manipulates information related to the assigned category of Unit responsibility. Evaluates current and anticipated workflow and explains to Unit Manager/Administrator why additional resources may be required. May coordinate cash activities related to assigned categories of Unit responsibility. Recommends and develops procedures for approval to track premiums receivable, claims payable and other cash activities. May coordinate handling of inter-company accounting related to multi-company programs that must be processed and reported by a specific company issuing the program policies. May complete special reports required by States or agencies by analyzing States’ or agencies’ requirements, determining data requirements, assessing and gathering data from appropriate source and compiling information to send to States or agencies. May prepare insurance information schedules, including premium , loss and reserve summaries, paid loss, reserve and incurred developments, and historic and current summaries of companies’ insurance data for review and use by company senior managers, BH Corporate, department managers, tax specialists, actuaries, examiners and IRS personnel for BH 10K reporting, management, tax, actuarial, audit and examination purposes. What are we looking for? Bachelor degree with major in accounting, math, computer science, business, MIS, or equivalent Personal computer and related software such as Excel, Access, and Visual Basic, spreadsheet and database application development 2-3 years related work experience Would prefer accounting workflow analysis and automated accounting systems development proficiency. Would prefer insurance and reinsurance statutory accounting and operations knowledge Who would excel in this role? Someone with the ability to analyze data and make recommendations concerning Company operations Strong problem solving Excellent oral and written communication with all levels of organization Proficiency with system documentation Strong personal computer skills The ability to compile, organize, and review large amounts of data for accuracy Willingness and ability to work overtime during seasonal demand Works with detail with accuracy Works independently Compose efficient and effective PC applications using software Works well with others Plan, prioritize, and meet deadlines Respond well to demands on time and resources Learn quickly We want you to be involved! We offer Employee Resource Groups for volunteering, connecting with others, social gatherings, and professional development as well as companywide surveys to hear from our employees.   We care about your health and wellbeing! Our Wellness program is integrated into the Company culture with an online wellness portal that offers a year-round, one-stop-shop to manage and track all areas of health, onsite fitness center, an Employee Relations team ready to assist you and more. Benefits, Perks and more! We offer retirement and savings plan with immediate enrollment with 100% employer match up to 5%, Medical, Dental and Vision for employees and eligible dependents, dedicated Learning & Development program for employees to grow personally and professionally, upfront Educational Reimbursement program, subsidized downtown parking, competitive time off policies including parental leave, an Employee Assistance program and much more! A comprehensive benefits package is available for regular, full-time employees, including health, vision, dental, life and disability insurance as well as a 401(k) with company match. We also proudly offer 100% upfront tuition reimbursement to regular, full-time employees, to further your education. Our Omaha office boasts a complimentary state-of-the-art, on-site gym, a robust wellness program, low-cost downtown parking, and numerous volunteer and networking opportunities with other emerging professionals. The Berkshire Hathaway Homestate Companies (BHHC) are a group of six insurance carrier that are part of the Berkshire Hathaway Insurance Group. Headquartered in Omaha, NE, and with more than 45 years in business, BHHC has evolved from a regional carrier to a national insurance group writing a diverse book of policies from coast to coast. We insure challenging classes in today’s commercial auto & property marketplace, such as trucking, public auto, vacant and rental properties, and so much more. BHHC has earned an enviable record of success in the insurance industry that is supported by A.M.Best’s highest financial strength rating of A++. We value each individual and recognize that attracting and retaining high quality talent is essential to the success of our company. With hands-on training and maintaining a small company feel within our larger organization, we have created an atmosphere where “team players” thrive. A comprehensive benefits package is available for regular, full-time employees, including health, vision, dental, life and disability insurance as well as a 401(k) with company match. We also proudly offer 100% upfront tuition reimbursement to regular, full-time employees, to further your education. Our Omaha office boasts a complimentary state-of-the-art, on-site gym, a robust wellness program, low-cost downtown parking, and numerous volunteer and networking opportunities with other emerging professionals.
